title: Canada: 4 missing after record-breaking downpours cause flooding
description: Intense thunderstorms dumped record amounts of rain across a wide swath of Canada's Atlantic-coast province of Nova Scotia over the past two days.

title: Thousands flee Greek island fires as heatwave continues around the world
description: July 2023 is on track to be the hottest month – not only since records began, but also in "hundreds, if not thousands, of years", said NASA climatologist.

title: Hundreds of thousands march in Israel against Netanyahu's judicial overhaul
description: Also Saturday, more than 100 of Israel's former security chiefs signed a letter pleading with the Israeli prime minister to halt the legislation.

title: Night trains are still waiting for their big break
description: As an attractive alternative to car or air travel to minimize carbon dioxide emissions, night trains are making a comeback in Europe. But the big bang their fervent advocates had hoped for is running up against numerous economic and industrial hurdles.

title: Marseille police officers 'strike' to protest the detention of one of their peers
description: The officer is accused of having beaten a 21-year-old man during the urban riots on the night of July 1.

title: From Castro to Putin: Depardieu's despot buddies
description: The Depardieu case 6|6. The French actor's fascination with strongmen and his appetite for good food and business deals have led him to rub shoulders with a host of dictators from the 1990s onwards.

title: France's draft biodiversity strategy finally unveiled
description: With four main objectives and 39 measures, the new roadmap is due to be finalized this fall. It will require substantial financial and human resources in order to be effectively implemented.

title: Tour de France 2023: Vingegaard almost guarantees back-to-back Tour de France victories
description: The Danish cyclist finished second on the 20th stage but he's leading his nearest rival, Tadej Pogacar, by almost seven and a half minutes.

title: Iraqis keep up protests after Quran burnings
description: Hundreds of supporters of Shiite Muslim cleric Muqtada Sadr tried to march to Baghdad's Green Zone believing a Quran had been desecrated in Denmark for the third time within a month.

title: US and Japan make fast World Cup starts, England face tough opener
description: The champions of Europe had to struggle for a 1-0 win over Haiti in its Women's World Cup debut on Saturday.

title: Farmers in the French Pyrenees are getting paid to maintain the landscape
description: The farmers Christophe Conein and Thomas Piquemal receive money to practise gentle farming in the foothills of the Pyrenees.

title: Greenland partly melted 400,000 years ago due to a global warming event similar to today's
description: The study published in the journal 'Science,' seems to show that the ice cap is at risk of irreversible melting over the coming centuries.

title: 'Life at 40°C is a nightmare': Greece faces longest and most intense heat wave in its history
description: In Athens, temperatures have exceeded 40°C for the last few days, and the worst is yet to come this weekend.

title: Road traffic on Crimea bridge halted after new explosion
description: According to the Moscow-backed Crimean government, the Ukrainian drone attack caused the 'detonation' of an ammunition depot.

title: Tour de France 2023: 'I feel like I don't deserve it,' Pinot thrills the crowds for his last dance
description: For the final Tour de France of his career, the Frenchman was cheered all the way along the route. On Saturday's stage, his supporters are planning a celebration.

title: 'Pastrami is a product of Ashkenazi culture'
description: 'A world of street food' (6/6). William Benitah crafts the Reuben, a pastrami sandwich with cheese, sauerkraut and sweet dressing, in his Paris delicatessen.

title: Macron sets the tone for his new government: 'Come on now, let's get moving'
description: The French head of state reaffirmed his confidence Prime Minister Borne on Friday, the day after the reshuffle. In response to critics, he boasted of setting a 'clear course,' making ecological planning a priority for the autumn.

title: Army reservists fiercely oppose Israel's Justice overhaul
description: Several hundred reservists have joined a protest of unprecedented scale, raising concerns about divisions within the military, of which they remain a pillar.

title: Russia targets Ukraine's farm storage sites after days of hitting Black Sea port facilities
description: Russia followed its withdrawal from a grain export deal by expanding its attacks from port infrastructure to farm storage buildings in the Odesa region on Friday, while also practicing a Black Sea blockade.

title: In Malaga, Picasso would no longer recognize his hometown
description: The Andalusian city has undergone a metamorphosis over the last 20 years, welcoming both tourists and new residents brought in by foreign companies with open arms. The cost of rent and living has skyrocketed as a result.

title: In Spain's Valencia region, conservative are mobilizing voters around a language battle
description: Defenders of the Valencian language fear that measures to protect their language will be called into question, leading to its decline.

title: Women's World Cup: Despite progress, women's football in England 'still finds itself in a startup phase'
description: After turning professional in 2018, English women's football is attracting a growing audience, but a recent review submitted to the government warns of the sport's economic vulnerability.

title: Lionel Messi scores during his Inter Miami debut against Cruz Azul
description: The Argentinian player has come on as a second-half substitute to make his Inter Miami debut against Cruz Azul in the Leagues Cup. The match is currently level at 2-1.

title: In Valencia, Spain's conservatives and far right experiment unprecedented alliance
description: The city is the scene of a rapprochement between the right-wing People's Party and the far-right Vox. The two parties are expected to come out ahead in the elections on Sunday.

title: North Korea fires 'several cruise missiles' into the Yellow Sea
description: South Korea's military says North Korea has fired several cruise missiles toward its western sea early in the morning on Saturday, July 22.

title: War in Ukraine: At the 'stabilization points,' where the wounds tell the stories of war
description: In these secret facilities, the wounded from the front lines are stabilized before being evacuated to hospitals. Mines, artillery, toxic gases and fragmentation weapons mutilate bodies.

title: Kylian Mbappe dropped from PSG preseason Asian tour
description: Paris Saint-Germain have left Kylian Mbappe out of the squad that will travel to Japan for their preseason tour after the striker confirmed he will not commit to a new contract.
